x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.potential_impact: A real-time, location-based disease tracker could help health authorities and citizens respond faster, allocate resources better, and reduce transmission.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Communities often lack real-time visibility into local disease outbreaks, leading to delayed responses and increased spread of illness.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

HealthMap would aggregate data from hospitals, clinics, and public health APIs to visualize outbreaks on a map. It would alert users in affected areas and suggest nearby testing centers or health resources.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • Integration with public health data sources (e.g., WHO, CDC)
  • Location services for mapping

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Ensuring data privacy and compliance (e.g., HIPAA)
  • Real-time data accuracy and availability
  • Managing false positives or misinformation
